rounds.category: NICE WORK IF YOU CAN GET IT

clues.text:
In 2007 this Apple CEO pocketed his annual $1 salary...
it's probably also worth noting his stake in Apple was $765 million
Initially yours: in 1895 his syndicate bought all of a $62 million bond issue, ending a gold shortage in the U.S. treasury
Start Microsoft with Bill like he did & you too can own stuff like NFL & NBA teams & a 60-ft. submarine (for your yacht!)
Italy's richest man as of 2007, this ex-prime minister has been estimated to be worth a cool $11.8 billion
Starting Google worked out well for Larry Page & him; as of 2007, they were worth $16.6 billion--apiece
In a 1939 film,  he played Mr. Jefferson Smith, an appointee to the U.S. Senate
This director of "Clerks" played Warlock in "Live Free or Die Hard"
This actress gives Lisa Simpson her distinctive voice
Dodie Smith wrote this classic tale about a plethora of puppies
On the Grammys in 2008, this partner of Louis Prima found "That Old Black Magic" in a duet with Kid Rock

rounds.comments: (Alex: We'll give you a quotation, you give us [*] of that quotation.)

clues.text: "And God said, Let there be light: and there was light"
"In this best of all possible worlds...Everything is for the best"
"The unexamined life is not worth living"
"In the middle of the journey of our life I came to myself within a dark wood"
"Joy, beautiful radiance of the gods, daughter of Elysium..."
Larry Bird was called the "Hick from French Lick"--this state was his home
William Jennings Bryan, the "Boy Orator of the Platte", knew the Platte primarily runs through this state
Brian Mulroney, "The Boy From Baie Comeau", grew up along the north banks of this river in Quebec
Nicolae Ceausescu was the "Butcher of" this Romanian city
Union Gen. George Henry Thomas was known as the "Rock of Chickamauga", Chickamauga being in this state
A type of boxing knockout
According to Ben Franklin, death & this were life's only certainties
Style of Mexican-American pop music made famous by Selena
This Belgian cartoon character & amateur detective has been an international favorite since 1929
Emperor from 14 to 37 A.D., he mailed it in the last 10 years from Capri

rounds.comments: (Alex: You must take the category in order, clues from top to bottom.)

clues.text: The Navajo are noted for their "paintings" done with this material that can be glued to a board
Her "Grey's Anatomy" character, Dr. Yang, had a difficult romance with Dr. Burke
William Sydney Porter started using this name while writing short stories from jail in Ohio
In 1893 he was chief engineer of Detroit's Edison Illuminating Company; 6 years later he'd form his own company
This novelist founded the English Review in 1908 & helped launch James Joyce's career
On December 19 the people of this U.S. state celebrate Princess Bernice Pauahi Bishop's birthday
In 1986 this New York capital celebrated the 300th anniversary of its charter as a city
This U.S. First Lady once taught dance in Grand Rapids
Lancaster, which has the largest stockyards east of Chicago, was this state's capital from 1799 to 1812
This Connecticut city famous for its university is nicknamed "Elm City" because it once had many elm-lined streets
In 1967 this New York Jets quarterback became the first pro to pass for more than 4,000 yards in a season
Founded in 1897, it's the world's oldest annual marathon
In 1991, after 12 seasons at the Salt Palace, this NBA team moved its home games to the Delta Center
In 1992 Viktor Petrenko won the world championship in this sport
During his 1955-1966 career, this Dodger pitcher averaged 9.28 strikeouts per 9 innings
The name of this food, not a true grain, comes from the Dutch meaning "beech wheat"
The rolled form of this grain cooks in about 5 minutes; the steel-cut takes much longer
Basmati, an aromatic type of this grain, is grown in India
Millet seed, an important food for North Africans, is most often fed to these pets in the U.S.
The pot type of this grain retains more of the bran than the pearl type
On April 5, 1614, in Jamestown, she married John Rolfe
Anna Ivanovna, empress of Russia from 1730 to 1740, was the niece of this great ruler
After 5 years in office, she resigned as Israeli prime minister in 1974
The proceeds from some of her souvenir hatchets helped fund a home for wives of alcoholics
In 1813 this mistress of the late Lord Nelson was imprisoned for debt
Since 1908 this group has distributed over 26 million Bibles to hotels & other institutions
It's what the R stands for in AARP
Not surprisingly, this organization, founded in 1884, maintains one of the world's finest reference libraries on dogs
Members of this volunteer crime-fighting organization are famous for wearing red berets
During Egypt's suspension from this group, 1979-1989, its headquarters was located in Tunisia
It's the 4-letter word that "makes the world go round"
There's "no time like" this
It's the type of pot that "never boils"
It "comes not alone" & "makes waste"
"Every" one of these "fits not every foot"

rounds.text: In 1937 his sister said he had "hats of every description" which he would use as a "foundation of his next book"
